title: 105_hr764
content:
The Act titled "Bankruptcy Amendments of 1997" includes definitions for various terms. The Act titled "Bankruptcy Amendments of 1997" includes amendments to Section 101 of title 11, United States Code, which defines various terms related to bankruptcy. Amendments include changes to paragraph designations, definitions of terms like "transfer," and adjustments to monetary thresholds. The Bankruptcy Amendments of 1997 revised Section 101 of title 11, United States Code, defining terms related to bankruptcy. The term "transfer" was redefined to include various modes of disposing of property or interests. Amendments also involved renumbering paragraphs and adjusting monetary thresholds. SEC. 3. ADJUSTMENT OF DOLLAR AMOUNTS. Amends Section 104 of title 11, United States Code by inserting references to specific sections. SEC. 4. EXTENSION OF TIME. Amends Section 108(c)(2) by updating references. SEC. 5. PENALTY FOR NEGLIGENCE OR FRAUD IN BANKRUPTCY PETITIONS. Amends Section 110(j)(3) by correcting a grammatical error. SEC. 6. LIMITATION ON COMPENSATION OF PROFESSIONALS. Amends Section 328(a) by specifying fee basis. SEC. 7. COMPENSATION TO OFFICERS. SEC. 7. COMPENSATION TO OFFICERS. Amends Section 330(a) of title 11, United States Code regarding compensation for officers and attorneys. SEC. 8. SPECIAL TAX PROVISIONS. Amends Section 346(g)(1)(C) by removing certain language. SEC. 9. EFFECT OF CONVERSION. Amends Section 348(f)(2) by clarifying property ownership. SEC. 10. AUTOMATIC STAY. SEC. 10. AUTOMATIC STAY. Amends Section 362(b) of title 11, United States Code to include a new provision regarding transfers that are not avoidable under specific sections. Section 365 of title 11, United States Code is amended to address default breaches in executory contracts and unexpired leases, specifying conditions under which a trustee cannot cure such defaults related to nonmonetary obligations. The amendment to Section 365 of title 11, United States Code addresses default breaches in executory contracts and unexpired leases, specifying conditions under which a trustee cannot cure defaults related to nonmonetary obligations. In subsection (c), paragraph (2) is amended by adding "or" at the end, paragraph (3) is revised to end with a period instead of "; or", and paragraph (4) is removed. In subsection (d), paragraphs (5) through (9) are struck, and paragraph (10) is redesignated as paragraph (5). In subsection (f)(1), the text following "; except that" is removed and replaced with a period. Section 1124(2) of title 11, United States Code is amended in subparagraph (A) by adding "or of a kind that section 365(b)(1)(A) of this title expressly does not require to be cured" before the semicolon at the end. In subsection (c), paragraph (2) is amended by adding "or" at the end, paragraph (3) is revised to end with a period instead of "; or", and paragraph (4) is removed. In subsection (d), paragraphs (5) through (9) are struck, and paragraph (10) is redesignated as paragraph (5). In subsection (f)(1), the text following "; except that" is removed and replaced with a period. Section 1124(2) of title 11, United States Code is amended by inserting a new subparagraph (D) that compensates holders for pecuniary loss due to failure to perform nonmonetary obligations. SEC. 12. AMENDMENT TO TABLE OF SECTIONS. The table of sections for chapter 5 of title 11, United States Code, is amended by updating section 556 to include a contractual right to liquidate commodities contracts or forward contracts.

SEC. 13. ALLOWANCE OF ADMINISTRATIVE EXPENSES. Section 503(b)(4) of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include subparagraphs (A), (B), (C), (D), or (E) before paragraph (3).

SEC. 14. PRIORITIES. Section 507(a) of title 11, United States Code, is amended to adjust the punctuation in paragraph (3)(B) and add "unsecured" after "allowed" in paragraph (7).

SEC. 15. EXEMPTIONS. SEC. 15. EXEMPTIONS. Section 522 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to clarify liabilities and support. SEC. 16. EXCEPTIONS TO DISCHARGE. Section 523 of title 11, United States Code, is amended to include new provisions related to transfers of property, exemptions, and exceptions to discharge in bankruptcy cases. In section 523 of title 11, United States Code, amendments include adding provisions for property transfers, exemptions, and exceptions to discharge in bankruptcy cases. Additionally, subsections are modified by inserting references to specific sections and correcting a typographical error. SEC. 17. Amendment to discharge effects under title 11, US Code. SEC. 18. Protection against discriminatory treatment in bankruptcy cases. SEC. 19. Amendment to property of the estate provisions. SEC. 20. Limitations on avoiding powers revised. SEC. 21. Preferences in bankruptcy proceedings. SEC. 21 amends Section 547 of title 11, US Code, regarding preferences in bankruptcy proceedings. It includes a new provision for avoiding security interests given between 90 days and 1 year before the petition filing date to benefit an insider creditor. SEC. 22 amends Section 549(c) of title 11, US Code, regarding postpetition transactions by clarifying interests in transfers of real property. SEC. 23 updates Section 553(b)(1) by changing a reference. SEC. 24 modifies Section 726(b) by removing a reference. SEC. 25 revises Section 901(a) by adding a new provision. SEC. 26 addresses the appointment of an elected trustee. SEC. 26 amends Section 1104(b) of title 11, US Code, regarding the appointment of an elected trustee. If a trustee is elected at a creditors' meeting, the United States trustee must certify the election. Any trustee appointed under subsection (d) will be replaced by the elected trustee. Disputes regarding the election will be resolved by the court. SEC. 27 to SEC. 31 amend various sections of title 11, United States Code, related to railroad line abandonment, plan contents, and discharge procedures. Amendments include changing references from section 11347 to section 11326(a) and updating subsections in different sections for clarity. SEC. 31 amends section 1328(a) of title 11, United States Code regarding discharge procedures in bankruptcy cases. SEC. 32 amends section 1334(d) of title 28, United States Code related to bankruptcy cases and proceedings. SEC. 33 addresses knowing disregard of bankruptcy law or rule. SEC. 33 amends section 156(a) of title 18, United States Code regarding knowing disregard of bankruptcy law or rule. SEC. 34 states that the Act and its amendments will take effect on the enactment date, with the amendments applying to cases under title 11 of the United States Code initiated after the enactment date.
